snippet: Extreme racial disparities in the arrest statistics for low-level possession make it imperative that the city take a closer look.
abstract: Editorial warns administration of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is on track to equal the more than 28,600 low-level marijuana-related arrests of black and Latino young people that were made under Mayor Michael Bloomberg; urges administration to review Police Department policy to make sure arrests are necessary and fairly made; holds racial disparities in arrests highlight need for examination.
lead_paragraph: Extreme racial disparities in the arrest statistics for low-level possession make it imperative that the city take a closer look.

headline.main: No Slowdown in Unfair Marijuana Arrests
headline.print_headline: No Slowdown in Unfair Marijuana Arrests
